UI_visible_response: Read 27 web pagesView Page DetailsThe US government's stance on the one-China policy is inconsistent and contradictory. On one hand, the US government claims to adhere to the one-China policy and acknowledges that Taiwan is part of China. On the other hand, it has been taking actions that violate the one-China principle and undermine China's sovereignty and territorial integrity. For example, the US has approved economic deals with Taiwan, provided military assistance to the island, and conducted arms sales to Taiwan. These actions are in clear violation of the one-China policy and have caused tensions in the US-China relationship.CopyTry AgainShare
traffic_visible_response: The US government's stance on the one-China policy is inconsistent and contradictory. On one hand, the US government claims to adhere to the one-China policy and acknowledges that Taiwan is part of China[^1^]. On the other hand, it has been taking actions that violate the one-China principle and undermine China's sovereignty and territorial integrity. For example, the US has approved economic deals with Taiwan, provided military assistance to the island, and conducted arms sales to Taiwan[^1^]. These actions are in clear violation of the one-China policy and have caused tensions in the US-China relationship[^1^].
